solution_line_template: He is open {hours_per_day}*{days_per_week}=<<{hours_per_day}*{days_per_week}={hours_open_per_week}>>{hours_open_per_week} hours a week
So he pays each of his employees {employee_hourly_wage}*{hours_open_per_week}=$<<{employee_hourly_wage}*{hours_open_per_week}={employee_weekly_wage}>>{employee_weekly_wage} per week

Since there are {num_employees_per_shift} employees, he pays them in total {num_employees_per_shift} * ${employee_weekly_wage} = $<<{num_employees_per_shift}*{employee_weekly_wage}={total_employee_wages_per_week}>>{total_employee_wages_per_week} per week.

So his total cost per week is {weekly_rent}+{total_employee_wages_per_week}+{utilities_cost}=$<<{weekly_rent}+{total_employee_wages_per_week}+{utilities_cost}={total_weekly_expenses}>>{total_weekly_expenses}
